title: Can’t be good at everything, Janna - that’s a job for Threeeeeeeeeeeeesh
body:
Somebody wrote this and nobody said "don't you think that's going to piss off the people who are paying attention to what's going on" (or somebody did and was fired for saying it). 

Thanks for continuing to make your balancing priorities clear, Riot. Fuck strategy, Thresh is more fun to watch than Janna, so down she goes while Thresh remains untouched. The ult healing nerf is just the sort of "fuck you" dingleberry on the neverending shit sundae that I've come to expect from Riot's balance team. 

Compensation buffs indeed. Max range is now 1741, down from 1760. Just like when the maximum knockup was increased along with a nerf to the instant cast duration, this is a straight nerf with a pie in the sky buff/compensation that will almost never actually matter. 

 Good at everything. Oh my God. Somebody wrote that. Janna is now good at damage! Janna can now reasonably expect to win a fight without simply running away from it! Janna can now function without an ally nearby! If the "good at everything" champs are all in line for nerfs in 5.18 you can find me at the hat buffet. Right after that I'll be handing out flying pigs and selling all kinds of bridges!

edit: I would additionally like to thank Riot for the absolutely scumbag move of sneaking this into patch notes with absolutely no warning or PBE time. All we had was the per second bonus increase, which, while sounding silly on paper (2255 range at full charge?) would NEVER BE RELEVANT ANYWAY. All this does is reinforce the instant cast use case, which is what Riot appears to be trying to kill. Bravo, Riot! You are bad at what you are trying to do and you are bad for trying to do it!

replies.body: Janna needed the nerf it isn't even that huge to be honest 0.1 ap ratio of the ult when Janna only builds like what 150-200 ap as a support maybe even lower. It will just drop her winrate by maybe 3% which than becomes a balanced champion at 51% .

> [{quoted}](name=Janna Smurf,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-09-01T19:31:54.546+0000)
>
> Janna needed the nerf it isn't even that huge to be honest 0.1 ap ratio of the ult when Janna only builds like what 150-200 ap as a support maybe even lower. It will just drop her winrate by maybe 3% which than becomes a balanced champion at 51% .

Agreed, but the point was that there are champs that need the nerf much, much more.

Well, that's not how that works. While other champs may be in a higher priority for nerfs, they can't very well ignore someone else that's lower priority.

Though I do agree that other people could use some taps, too.

I guess I disagree with you. If someone is "higher priority", then the "lower priority" champs should be ignored until the top gets knocked down. But every year when Worlds roles around, we see the LC$ champs get buffed. And the non-flashy champs get nerfed.

The main problem with doing that is that the lower priority champions then become the higher priority champions immediately after, and is inevitably permanently cyclical. To prevent a cycle, you have to break that cycle, which means going against what that cycle does - in this case, nerfing "lower priority" champions at the same time, or before, "higher priority" champions. 

Skarner needs nerfs. Just going to throw that right out there. However, if someone is doing inordinately well in the same or different role, that doesn't mean they should be able to skate by under the radar just because Skarner needs a nerf more than they do. 

It's less a priority system, and more of an ever-evolving system. And remember, unlike DotA2, you have a whole team of people on the balance team, so you have people that may agree with you, and people that may also disagree (unlike in DotA2, where your balance team is composed thusly: IceFrog. And end credits), so you end up with nerfs like this alongside larger ones and smaller ones, in addition to buffs.

Not saying either of our systems are better or worse, just saying that doing one or the other too much is bad - equally bad.

I don't think Janna needed the nerf at all? She has REALLY defined strengths and weaknesses. She's better than any Support at disengaging by a long shot, but she sucks in a lot of aspects like poke, hard engage, tankiness. I don't think Janna's only strength should be disengage. It clearly isn't her only strength, but why does one of the most iconic healing abilities in the game that has been long considered balanced suddenly need a nerf?
It was never considered a strong healing ability. Janna rarely use her ult for it's heal except for maybe earlier on where the AP ratio shouldn't matter that much anyways.

Yeah thresh is the jack of all trades i agree.. Kinda surprised his win rate isn't higher but i guess part of that is the lack of communication in solo Q (text vs verbal)  But yeah his ability to CC is among the highest in the game, he can play back in team fights and throw lanterns to save people or play forward as an off tank. I guess he's like the old season 4 Lee Sin, except i find thresh to be a more exaggerated version of that because thresh only becomes more and more valuable/stronger as the game goes on. 

I'm sure many people have come up with ideas to balance Thresh, but none will be considered :)

threshs win rate is so low because he he actually has a ton of weaknesses.  Hes the squishiest tank support, his hook is one of the easiest skillshots to dodge around.  His ult requires you to be in the middle of the enemy team to be any good.  You have to last hit minions really well to use relic shield.

> [{quoted}](name=Hullabaloo907,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-09-01T19:46:46.328+0000)
>
> threshs win rate is so low because he he actually has a ton of weaknesses.  Hes the squishiest tank support, his hook is one of the easiest skillshots to dodge around.  His ult requires you to be in the middle of the enemy team to be any good.  You have to last hit minions really well to use relic shield.

Thresh's win rate is low because he is the most used support, and with so many people playing him, his win rate tends to be low because there are many people who are bad with him.

Champions who are used a lot tend to have low win rate due to this reason. When a champion has high win rate AND high pick rate, then there is something wrong with that champion.
Champions who have a low pick- AND winrate are definitely in need of changes, too. {{champion:69}}
Hence Riot debating Vayne nerfs
I'm confused. You have to last-hit "really well" when relic shield has a minion execute specifically designed so you **don't** have to last hit really well?

> [{quoted}](name=Vekkna,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=000000000001,timestamp=2015-09-01T20:56:04.344+0000)
>
> I'm confused. You have to last-hit "really well" when relic shield has a minion execute specifically designed so you **don't** have to last hit really well?

Doesnt work for thresh since his AA is technically ranged.
Thresh has a low win rate because he is hard to play and you need to have intense mechanix and skills to succeed, unlike Janna.
Let me guess. You play things like Zed, Thresh, and Riven, don't you?
Do you not understand the satire here?

This is the internet 
For satire to succeed, it must have the subtlety of the Hulk on both cocaine and amphetamines

I play Zed.

I rarely go botlane, maybe once ever 100+ games, but when I do, I play Thresh, not good at him though.

I don't play Riven, Riven animation cancling is too hard, the mechanix and skill needed are too intense.
I would probably say Janna is one of the harder Supports to play. Mastering her is worth it though.

Honestly, when i am in suport and i wantto win, i will pick janna. 

I might not be the best, but she is pretty easy.

You want to trade E AA
Disengage their engage with q and ult
Use w for picks and some peel

Yes but most of her "good plays" are hard to pull off. 

For example Thresh E can disengage things like J4 E+Q or Lee Q. Now Janna can do this too, but it's a tad harder because you have to double Q as fast as you can. Sure it's not super hard, but thresh E trick is easier to pull off.

there hasn't been a single point in the game where janna hasn't been a good pick as support and i'd much rather have a good janna over a good thresh

you can argue the very valid point that thresh has never been bad, but janna has been a rusty, stripped screw for far too long

> [{quoted}](name=Enosense,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-09-01T19:33:36.796+0000)
>
> there **hasn't been a single point in the game where janna hasn't been a good pick as support **and i'd much rather have a good janna over a good thresh
> 
> you can argue the very valid point that thresh has never been bad, but janna has been a rusty, stripped screw for far too long

Uhhhhh Season 3 and a lot of Season 4? (basically before worlds).

I remember buying Janna and everyone I knew didn't want me to practice her because she was considered bad.

If you want to talk about a support that has never been considered a back pick, that is {{champion:412}} ; indisputable.
Season 4, yes. Season 3? She was in the trifecta of supports. Her Thresh and Leo. Basically one big fast triangle of counters.

> [{quoted}](name=Gorgannan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2015-09-01T21:30:40.857+0000)
>
> Season 4, yes. Season 3? She was in the trifecta of supports. Her Thresh and Leo. Basically one big fast triangle of counters.

Leona wasn't a popular pick until season 4.
Idk what game you were playing. Leona was at her strongest in season 3.

Leona was an OK pick until the start of season 4 did the following for her:

- Eliminated vision wars, which allowed more income for actual tank items.
- Introduction of the Relic Shield and it's upgrades
- Reduction of damage ratios and base utility on other supports as a result of the introduction of scaling utility (this made most supports take a hit on their early game, which allowed Leona to ha a more powerful presence)
- Eclipse (W) got a 20% scaling on bonus Ar/MR in exchange of 5 base Ar/MR. A net buff, since that much is easily recovered with runes alone.

Season 3 Leona was nowhere near as strong as Season 4 Leona, and lead to the frequent Morgana support pick specifically to counter her (and because morgana could abuse Frostfang).

> [{quoted}](name=Gorgannan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2015-09-01T21:30:40.857+0000)
>
> Season 4, yes. Season 3? She was in the trifecta of supports. Her Thresh and Leo. Basically one big fast triangle of counters.

I remember back in my day when it was Blitzcrank or AFK. Back before Thresh.

Are you sure you're not confusing Janna with another champion? She was picked and banned zero times in S3 Worlds.

http://www.gosugamers.net/lol/features/3493-stats-corner-the-numbers-from-season-3-world-championship

The most popular supports were:
Sona: 13% ban + 57% pick = 70% contested
Thresh: 37% ban + 29% pick = 66% contested
Annie: 11% ban + 8% pick = 19% contested (almost exclusively picked by and banned against Tabe of Royal Club, who popularised support-Annie)
Leona: 2% ban + 16% pick = 18% contested
Thresh probably never will be considered a bad pick. His kit doesn't allow it. It's the perfect kit for this kind of champion but a little bit overloaded when seen in context with other supports.

> [{quoted}](name=Enosense,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-09-01T19:33:36.796+0000)

what the fuck are you talking about?

this guy clearly hasn't been playing in season 3, playing Janna was next to trolling

and Thresh nerfs are needed, there is no way someone can manage to have 48% winrate with 36% pickrate while being hard to play (among supports of course) without being straight broken
I played in S3 and I remember her having an insane winrate with a decent pickrate. I think you're thinking early s4.

> [{quoted}](name=Gorgannan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-09-01T21:31:15.264+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=Gorgannan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-01T23:00:03.803+0000)

No,she was bad at s3,enemy would just pick a sona and obliterate you,she wasn't even good at solo q,she was good against people who didn't play support,and the role was much less popular back then.

> [{quoted}](name=manbearswine,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=000200000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-03T08:35:18.446+0000)
>
> No,she was bad at s3,enemy would just pick a sona and obliterate you,she wasn't even good at solo q,she was good against people who didn't play support,and the role was much less popular back then.

As I recall, she was good in S2, bad in S3, really good once supports started getting gold, then back to okay with scaling utility and trending downwards with constant nerfs.

If your ADC sucks, you have no hope of feeding them a kill and you probably can't keep them alive if you're vs. Blitz or Thresh (yes, R, but they'll murder a bad ADC long before then).  You have to hope they know that shield == trade, otherwise your best hope is to keep them alive.

Anyone with hard CC and burst (e.g. Annie/Pantheon/etc.) erases you on contact.  If your team is behind, you don't have much hope of turning that around.  If your team is way ahead, you'll probably keep their team from from catching back up, barring them having good wombo ability.

So the R nerf was pointless... you very rarely channel it for healing.  The Q nerf is big, though.  People have been playing her for 3-4 years now with that Q range.  I find it interesting that one of the champs with the least damage in the game has been nerfed so very many times in so many ways, though.

> [{quoted}](name=Qsario,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E41bEILl,comment-id=0002000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2015-09-04T03:45:35.799+0000)
>
> As I recall, she was good in S2,

Yeah was op in competitive as well.

 >bad in S3,

yep.

>really good once supports started getting gold,

I don't think that was it,I think she really started to shine with the adc itemization buffs.

 >then back to okay with scaling utility and trending downwards with constant nerfs.

Riot has an issue with winrates,I wonder what they think will happen to zyra by buffing her largest aoe,go figure.

> If your ADC sucks, you have no hope of feeding them a kill and you probably can't keep them alive if you're vs. Blitz or Thresh (yes, R, but they'll murder a bad ADC long before then).  You have to hope they know that shield == trade, otherwise your best hope is to keep them alive.

If your adc is bad you are kinda in a bad spot anyway,I think janna is still decent even if he is bad,unless he is REALLY BAD,but then you are pretty damn screwed regardless of anything.

> Anyone with hard CC and burst (e.g. Annie/Pantheon/etc.) erases you on contact.

They kinda need to get in range,and you are faster,also to blow burst on you,which is questionable,also she tends to get locket and then with her shield she isn't too squishy anymore.

 >If your team is behind, you don't have much hope of turning that around.  If your team is way ahead, you'll probably keep their team from from catching back up, barring them having good wombo ability.

to some extent,but you can always hope they will throw.

> So the R nerf was pointless... you very rarely channel it for healing.  The Q nerf is big, though.  People have been playing her for 3-4 years now with that Q range.  I find it interesting that one of the champs with the least damage in the game has been nerfed so very many times in so many ways, though.

Because damage is highly overrated,but well,riot balances around winrate to a very large extent,it's retarded,but not really surprising anymore,sona was nerfed for winrate,amumu was nerfed for winrate,zyra was nerfed for winrate,now janna is nerfed for winrate.

I'll never understand why Thresh players think their skillshot is the skilliest of skill shots. To listen to them talk Thresh dies faster than Sona, moves slower than Zyra, heals for less than Annie, does less damage than Janna, has less cc than Soraka, burns mana faster than Lux, and commits more to all-ins than Leona.
are we ignoring the fact that it says draven and not thresh
Yes.

The Draven line is contextually a joke, referring to the Draven buffs listed previously.

In a vacuum, it was entertaining.

In the broader context of the state of balance of this game, and the priorities of the team ostensibly tasked with managing it, it is incredibly depressing.

Everything is in a vaccuum, but when things become broader they're always going to be less enjoyable. 
{{champion:31}} , {{champion:223}} , and {{champion:96}} eating everything is humerous, but when you look at a broader scope of the children starving in Africa, then of course it becomes less funny.

I think Rito was just trying to make a joke, and not a commentary on Janna VS Thresh utility.
They don't want anyone's healing abilities aside from Raka to rival a Relic Shield.  It would be imbalanced
Janna's W damages too. I have killed more with W than anything else on Janna.

I've gotten kills with W.

I've also won 4v5's.

Janna isn't about damage. You know that going in. The problem here is, Riot doesn't want her to be about -anything-, writing bullshit patch notes like this while much greater offenders run around untouched.

{{champion:412}} Everything in the game for CC and more besides sustain
{{champion:40}} A knockup that is usually never wound up at all and used as reactionary- Oh wait that was removed.  A w that slows, E is a shield and ult pushes back while also healing. Janna, why are you so broken? {{summoner:1}} -Riot

Janna and Thresh would both be exactly as useful as they are if they dealt 0 damage.

My problem is, why does Janna actually deal 0 damage and Thresh deal fucktons of it? And Janna's the one getting nerfed?

Like, I know it's popular to hate Thresh, but seriously, you're delusional if you think Janna can't rival Thresh as a top support in the game. Not to mention being way easier to play. Thresh is hard to play to his highest potential. It's pretty easy as Janna to press E on the ADC and outrun everyone just because you're Janna (Not that that's her highest potential, but it's still a ton of free power for no skill).

Thresh is hard to play to his highest potential. It's pretty easy as Janna to press E on the ADC and outrun everyone just because you're Janna (Not that that's her highest potential, but it's still a ton of free power for no skill).
